    • Constructor Detail

      • Mario

        public Mario(double posX,
             double posY,
             double width,
             double height)
        Description: This function allows to initialize a new Mario.
        Parameters:
        posX - the position in the X axis of Mario in the level
        posY - the position in the Y axis of Mario in the level
        width - the width of Mario in pixels
        height - the height of Mario in pixels

    • Method Detail

      • getPowerState

        public PowerUp getPowerState()
        Description: This function obtains the power state of Mario.
        Returns:
        The power state that Mario has at the moment of this function being called.

      • setPowerState

        public void setPowerState(PowerUp powerState)
        Description: This function modifies Mario's power state.
        Parameters:
        powerState - The new power state of Mario.

      • getState

        public java.lang.String getState()
        Description: This function obtains the moving state of Mario.
        Returns:
        The moving state of Mario at the moment.

      • setState

        public void setState(java.lang.String state)
        Description: This function modifies the moving state of Mario.
        Parameters:
        state - The new moving state of Mario.

      • isColliding

        public java.lang.String isColliding(double x2,
                                    double y2,
                                    double w2,
                                    double h2)
        Description: This function determines whether or not mario is colliding with another block and also in what way he's colliding. In other words, it tells if Mario is colliding from above, below, right or left of him.
        Parameters:
        x2 - The other block's x coordinate.
        y2 - The other block's y coordinate.
        w2 - The other block's width coordinate.
        h2 - The other block's height coordinate.
        Returns:
        A string representing the direction in which Mario is colliding or an empty String is Mario is not colliding.

      • isGrounded

        public java.lang.String isGrounded(double x2,
                                   double y2,
                                   double w2,
                                   double h2)
        Description: This function determines whether or not Mario is standing on something and if he is, it tells if it's with the floor or not.
        Parameters:
        x2 - The other block's x coordinate.
        y2 - The other block's y coordinate.
        w2 - The other block's width coordinate.
        h2 - The other block's height coordinate.
        Returns:
        A string representing a collision with the floor or just a collision, in case of there being no collision it returns an empty string.

      • isThereSomethingInBetween

        public boolean isThereSomethingInBetween(double x2,
                                         double y2,
                                         double w2,
                                         double h2,
                                         double yFinal,
                                         double yActual)
        Description: This function is used for Mario's jump to detect if Mario is in between something in every interval of the jump, this information is used for collision detection.
        Parameters:
        x2 - The other block's x coordinate.
        y2 - The other block's y coordinate.
        w2 - The other block's width coordinate.
        h2 - The other block's height coordinate.
        yFinal - The final y coordinate of Mario when he jumps.
        yActual - The current y coordinate of Mario in the jump.
        Returns:
        True if Mario is actually in between something for collision detection or false if he isn't.

      • nextPowerUp

        public PowerUp nextPowerUp()
        Description: This function obtains Mario's next power up, if he's in small form, he'd get a Mushroom however, if he's in big form he'd get a flower power up.
        Returns:
        Mario's next power up when he collides with a mistery block.

      • isEnemyNear

        public boolean isEnemyNear(double posX)
        Description: This function determines whether or not an enemy is close enough to Mario in order for him to start walking.
        Parameters:
        posX - The enemy's position in the x axis.
        Returns:
        True if the enemy is beneath the distance threshold and false if it isn't.
